title: TINY TRACTOR TINY FARM: JOHN DEERE 1025R IS KILLIN' IT!

tasks.task: Driving a tractor and operating farm equipment
subtasks: Operating a box blade with a tractor to till garden areas
Using a stump bucket to remove shrubs and timbers
Utilizing a brush crusher to manage landscaping vegetation
Maneuvering around honey bees and other potential hazards on the farm
Moving dirt and sand berms from around the house to behind the barn
Considering safety measures when working near existing structures (e.g., beehive)
Using a heavy hitch tooth bar for added stability and cutting efficiency
Evaluating the performance of Bora wheel spacers on a tractor for better stability

tasks.task: Using hydraulic attachments on a John Deere tractor
subtasks: Operating a third-function hydraulic brush crusher attachment
Explaining the benefits and application of John Deere quick attach systems
Cautioning about potential encounters with a killer rooster and coyotes

tasks.task: Addressing payment arrangements for farm services
subtasks: Considering alternative forms of compensation (e.g., honey, eggs) for services rendered

tasks.task: Showcasing agricultural techniques and machinery operation
subtasks: Demonstrating the use of tiller teeth for garden preparation
Discussing the limitations of a small tractor with a light box blade for deep tilling
Highlighting the importance of proper tooling and attachments for efficient farming operations
IDENTIFY PROJECT LOCATION AND SCOPE
ENUMERATE PROJECT TASKS AND TIMESCHEDULE
ASSESS TEAM ABILITY AND ORGANIZE WORKFORCE
MANAGE PROJECT QUALITY CONTROL AND RESOURCES
COMMUNICATE WITH CUSTOMER ON PROJECT PROGRESS
